Which sector, in your opinion, plays the most important role in driving the economic condition of a country? Please elaborate with reasons and examples. 

       All the sectors in a country are equally important for the development of a nation.But a country's economic development is purely based on the power  and physical infrastructure it possess. A large number of foreign  foreign investors like the FDI's or the FII's invest in any nation looking at the power producing capability of the country.Based on WEF i.e World Economic Forum's report India stands in 76th position in terms of power and 98th position in physical infrastructure, out of 118 countries. 

       The economic conditions of a country depends upon the GDP, therefore inorder to improve this production capabilities and huge industries are prominent which would support and boost the economy. Apart from the domestic industries most of the countries de-regulate their barriers to a certain extent to attract foreign investors.For example the introduction of LPG i.e Liberalization Privatization and Globalization in 1990's  has opened the doors for foreign power producing companies to enter into India and start their operations.The main attracting factor for any foreign investor in any sector, to enter into a country like India is the purchasing power of the population, but inorder to run their production operations power is a major concern, parallely the transport infrastructure (physical infrastructure) is also important to make their products reach the consumer. 

        Therefore in a country like India where it has got a huge power crunch and a very low physical infrastructural facilities, economic development will not be rapid unless these areas are improved.
